page.title: 04GILLINGHAM'S HERITAGE
page.content: {ROMAN:}Skeleton of local Roman in Gillingham museum. {SAXON:}Part of decorated cross in St.Mary's Church,Gillingham. {NORMAN:}Hunting Palace called King's Court,is now grass mounds and ditches. {MEDIEVAL:}Decorated Gothic chancel of St. Mary's Church,Gillingham. {TUDOR & STUART:}Stone tomb of Jessop brothers in north chapel of St Mary's. {QUEEN ANNE:}Lime Tree House in Queen Street, a fine stone example. {GEORGIAN:}Town Mills once made silk and ground flour:now a burned ruin. {LATE GEORGIAN:}Stone lock up with no windows, for drunks or criminals. {VICTORIAN:}Milestone,engraved Shaston 4 & Wincanton 7 near rail bridge. Royal Hotel with lion on porch & classical pillars. {EDWARDIAN:}Westminster Bank with classical pillars.
